page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF MARYKIRK AREA
page.content: This is predominantly an agricultural area, being situated at the south of the fertile Howe of the Mearns. Farms have been established in the district for over 100 years. A few acres of land is forested by the Forestry Commission. The village of Marykirk with a population of 210 - 220 has 1 combined post office and general merchant, 1 general merchant a hotel, a Presbyterian Church, l public hall, a recreation park and a 2 - teacher school. The River North Esk, which flows to the west of the village, is crossed by a railway viaduct carrying the main Aberdeen, London line and by an old toll road bridge on the border of Grampian and Tayside Regions.
